weloveclouds.client.utils

Class ArgumentsValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • weloveclouds.client.utils.ArgumentsValidator

  • public class ArgumentsValidator
extends java.lang.Object
    Validates the arguments of the different commands (ClientCommand).

    • Constructor Summary

      ArgumentsValidator()

      static void validateCLIArgumentsForClientStart(java.lang.String[] arguments)
      Validate CLI arguments for the server starting.
      static void validateConnectArguments(java.lang.String[] arguments, ServerConnectionInfo remoteServer)
      A connect command is valid, if:
      (1) the 0. parameter of arguments is a valid IP address, and
      (2) the 1st parameter of arguments is a valid port, and
      (3) these are the only arguments.
      static void validateDisconnectArguments(java.lang.String[] arguments)
      A disconnect command is valid, if it does not contain any argument.
      static void validateGetArguments(java.lang.String[] arguments)
      A get command is valid, if:
      (1) the KEY_INDEX parameter of arguments is a key, and
      (2) and the size of the key is at most KEY_SIZE_LIMIT_IN_BYTES bytes, and
      (3) that is the only argument.
      static void validateHelpArguments(java.lang.String[] arguments)
      A help command is valid, if it does not contain any argument.
      static void validateLogLevelArguments(java.lang.String[] arguments)
      A logLevel command is valid, if:
      (1) the LEVEL_INDEXelement of the arguments array is a log level, and
      (2) the log level is one of those in LogLevel.
      static void validatePutArguments(java.lang.String[] arguments)
      A put command is valid, if:
      (1) the KEY_INDEX parameter of arguments is a key, and
      (2) all other parameters starting from VALUE_INDEX parameter of the arguments are regarded and merged as value, and
      (3) these are the only arguments, and
      (4) and the size of the key is at most KEY_SIZE_LIMIT_IN_BYTES bytes, and
      (5) and the size of the value is at most VALUE_SIZE_LIMIT_IN_BYTES bytes.
      static void validateQuitArguments(java.lang.String[] arguments)
      A quit command is valid, if it does not contain any argument.

    • Method Detail

      • validateCLIArgumentsForClientStart

        public static void validateCLIArgumentsForClientStart(java.lang.String[] arguments)
                                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Validate CLI arguments for the server starting. The arguments are valid, if:
        (1) there are exactly REQUIRED_CLI_ARGUMENT_NUMBER number of arguments, and
        (2) the argument at the position CLI_CLIENT_NAME_INDEX is a non-empty string
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a validation error occurs

      • validateConnectArguments

        public static void validateConnectArguments(java.lang.String[] arguments,
                                            ServerConnectionInfo remoteServer)
                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        A connect command is valid, if:
        (1) the 0. parameter of arguments is a valid IP address, and
        (2) the 1st parameter of arguments is a valid port, and
        (3) these are the only arguments.
        The remoteServer already contains the IP address and the port.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is a validation error

      • validatePutArguments

        public static void validatePutArguments(java.lang.String[] arguments)
                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        A put command is valid, if:
        (1) the KEY_INDEX parameter of arguments is a key, and
        (2) all other parameters starting from VALUE_INDEX parameter of the arguments are regarded and merged as value, and
        (3) these are the only arguments, and
        (4) and the size of the key is at most KEY_SIZE_LIMIT_IN_BYTES bytes, and
        (5) and the size of the value is at most VALUE_SIZE_LIMIT_IN_BYTES bytes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is a validation error

      • validateGetArguments

        public static void validateGetArguments(java.lang.String[] arguments)
                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        A get command is valid, if:
        (1) the KEY_INDEX parameter of arguments is a key, and
        (2) and the size of the key is at most KEY_SIZE_LIMIT_IN_BYTES bytes, and
        (3) that is the only argument.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is a validation error

      • validateLogLevelArguments

        public static void validateLogLevelArguments(java.lang.String[] arguments)
                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        A logLevel command is valid, if:
        (1) the LEVEL_INDEXelement of the arguments array is a log level, and
        (2) the log level is one of those in LogLevel.
        Parameters:
        arguments - LEVEL_INDEX element of the array contains the log level
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if

      • validateDisconnectArguments

        public static void validateDisconnectArguments(java.lang.String[] arguments)
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        A disconnect command is valid, if it does not contain any argument.
        Parameters:
        arguments - shall be empty
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is a validation error

      • validateHelpArguments

        public static void validateHelpArguments(java.lang.String[] arguments)
                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        A help command is valid, if it does not contain any argument.
        Parameters:
        arguments - shall be empty
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is a validation error

      • validateQuitArguments

        public static void validateQuitArguments(java.lang.String[] arguments)
                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        A quit command is valid, if it does not contain any argument.
        Parameters:
        arguments - shall be empty
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is a validation error
